 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָגַג‎</span>] **verb** ==make pilgrimage, keep a pilgrim-feast== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***betake oneself to or towards an object of reverence; make a pilgrimage to Mecaa***; Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגג‎</span> ***make pilgrimage*** [[BDB#SabDenkm|SabDenkm]]<sup>86. compare 85</sup>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***celebrate a feast.*** In Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגגו‎</span> is proper name [[BDB#Vog|Vog]]<sup>No. 61</sup>; compare also Phoenician proper name <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגת‎</span>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַגֹּתֶם‎</span> [[Exod.12.14|Exod 12:14]] + 2 t.; ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּחֹג‎</span> [[Exod.23.14|Exod 23:14]]; [[Deut.16.15|Deut 16:15]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָח֫וֺגּוּ‎</span> [[Ps.107.27|Ps 107:27]] ([[BDB#Bö|Bö]]<sup>§ 1118</sup> (2)); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיָחֹ֫גּוּ‎</span> [[Exod.5.1|Exod 5:1]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּחֹ֫גּוּ‎</span> [[Lev.23.39|Lev 23:39]]; [[Lev.23.41|Lev 23:41]] ***suffix*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּחָגֻּ֫הוּ‎</span> [[Exod.12.14|Exod 12:14]] ***Imperative*** feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָגִּי‎</span> [[Nah.2.1|Nah 2:1]] ***Infinitive*** construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹג‎</span> [[Zech.14.18|Zech 14:18]] + 2t., ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוֺגֵג‎</span> [[Ps.42.5|Ps 42:5]] plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹגְַגִים‎</span> [[1Sam.30.16|1Sam 30:16]] — 

**1.** ***keep a pilgrim-feast***, absolute [[Exod.5.1|Exod 5:1]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]) of one proposed by Moses; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁלשׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רגלים תחג לי‎</span> ***three times shalt thou make pilgrimage unto me*** (in the year) [[Exod.23.14|Exod 23:14]] (covt. code); of pilgrim-feasts in general [[Nah.2.1|Nah 2:1]], the Passover [[Exod.12.14|Exod 12:14]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); elsewhere feast of Booths; all celebrated in part by sacred processions and dances; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎המון חוגג‎</span> [[Ps.42.5|Ps 42:5]] ***multitude keeping festival*** (led by the Psalmist in procession); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגג‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חג‎</span> [[Lev.23.39|Lev 23:39]] ([[BDB#H|H]]), [[Num.29.12|Num 29:12]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Nah.2.1|Nah 2:1]]; [[Zech.14.16|Zech 14:16]]; [[Zech.14.18|Zech 14:18]]; [[Zech.14.19|Zech 14:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חגג אתו חג‎</span> [[Exod.12.14|Exod 12:14]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Lev.23.41|Lev 23:41]] ([[BDB#H|H]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אתוֺ‎</span> [[Lev.23.41|Lev 23:41]] ([[BDB#H|H]]); suffix [[Exod.12.14|Exod 12:14]] ([[BDB#P|P]]). 

**2.** behave as at a <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָג‎</span> [[1Sam.30.16|1Sam 30:16]] (of the Amalekites when surprised by David i.e. ***enjoying themselves merrily***, [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]; others, ***circling in the sacred dance***). 

**3.** ***reel***, in giddiness on the sea [[Ps.107.27|Ps 107:27]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָגָּא‎</span> [[Isa.19.17|Isa 19:17]]); this either points to an earlier meaning of √; or better, the Psalm being late, means ***reel*** as from festival excesses (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיָנוּעוּ כַשִּׁכּוֺר‎</span>).
